result.title: First draft of implementation plan
result.description: A first version of the Implementation Plan will be released at month 32 in order to have the time to discuss it and further develop via contributions from all the relevant groups The aim is to involve all stakeholders and interest groups identified under WP3 from the beginning achieving coownership and codesign of the Implementation Plan The ultimate goal is to have mature actions that are ready to compete for funding at a basin level at the end of the project In the Implementation Plan attention will be paid to avoid overlap with existing initiatives or projects and to focus on actions from which a high added value is expected in the Black Sea region It will also explore and provide recommendations on the most suitable cooperation mechanisms and tools to implement each particular action The specific nature and needs of each action will be considered in link with task 22 and also with WP3 Bilateral activities will be defined leading to multilateral cooperation in the Black Sea There will be two drafts of the Implementation Plan at month 32 and at the end on month 45 The first draft will be prepared by project partners in order to facilitate the next phase for all stakeholders The initial draft will be presented in the following HLB meeting with all stakeholders participating and actively contributing From then onwards and until the end of the project stakeholder involvement will be continuous

result.title: Final version of Implementation Plan
result.description: There will be two drafts of the Implementation Plan at month 32 and at the end on month 45 The first draft will be prepared by project partners in order to facilitate the next phase for all stakeholders The initial draft will be presented in the following Black Sea WGGSO meeting with all stakeholders participating and actively contributing From then onwards and until the end of the project stakeholder involvement will be continuous Dedicated meetings will be organised every year at the national and international levels to develop a viable and effective Implementation Plan for the whole Black Sea region The final Implementation Plan will be presented and discussed in the Final Conference and delivered at the end of the CSA

result.title: Handbook of relevant Black Sea projects, initiatives and entities, including the modes of engagement
result.description: By the month 6 of the CSA a comprehensive list of linked entities projects associations and initiatives will be generated and put up in the Black Sea Blue Growth Initiative web site This document will be a living database that will be regularly updated and improved every six months In the first meetings of the Black Sea Blue Growth Initiative within the first 6 months a priority list of these undertakings and a roadmap for engagement will be worked out and a second stage will commence

result.title: Report on the establishment of operational network, including a list of relevant funding agencies
result.description: Task 31 Operational Network of Funders and Key Players Lead METUWorking in close collaboration with Tasks 21 and 23 this task will first identify national and international actors to establish a comprehensive platform funders universities and research centres clusters SMEs NGOs investors and alike based on the pillars of the Burgas Vision Paper These national platforms will become actively involved in the operational Black Sea Network including those with priority in the investment the commercialization and the involvement of the industry sectors Public agencies and ministerial institutions will be an integral part of the platform as well This deliverable will report the detailed results of these activities The report will be delivered in coleadership with METU and NWIM RANEPA METU as the task lead will provide full support for the development of the Operational Network and the deliverable

result.title: Assessment of ceramic tiles coated with novel glazes.
result.description: This document will consist of demonstrating the feasibility of using successfully the new ceramic pigments in the production of real ceramic tiles The new formulation of ceramic glazes for ceramic porcelain stoneware tiles will be developed where the pigments will be tested Several samples of tiles will be provided including the new pigments in the glaze finishing of the tile surface

result.title: Cross-border collaboration in the context of EOSC
result.description: D 26 Crossborder collaboration in the context of EOSC This deliverable will review and assess the value and impact of the collaboration model proposed by EOSC in the Nordic and Baltic countries Particular attention will be paid to costrecovery and business models which will be tested against the demonstrators carried out in WP5 and the concrete usage of services made available via the EOSC catalogue The deliverable will assess the real costs of opening up services as part of EOSC and propose relevant funding and business models to sustain these services as part of EOSC

result.title: Report/booklet with recommendations
result.description: The deliverable will contain the recommendations produced within task 45 The recommendations will gather the results found lessons learnt and best practices for improving accessibility to digital transport as practical strategies supporting the collective learning for a more inclusive digital transportIt will consist of a booklet edited in a very direct style with easytoapply recommendations addressed to the different actors with special interest in policymakers and other practitioners
